title: Open Technology Research Officially Launches to Strengthen Global Research Community
content: Brussels, February 2026 – OpenForum Europe (OFE), the Open Source Initiative (OSI), and the Open Knowledge Foundation (OKFN) announced last Friday, 30 January at the EU Open Source Policy Summit the official launch of Open Technology Research (OTR) — a strategic partnership designed to strengthen the global open technology research community and advance evidence-based policymaking around open technologies. title: OpenForum Europe Appoints Laszlo Igneczi as Executive Director
content:
OFE Open Source Policy Summit 2026, Brussels – 31 January 2026

OpenForum Europe (OFE) is pleased to announce the appointment of Laszlo Igneczi as its new Executive Director. The announcement marks the start of a new chapter for the organisation as it enters its twenty-fourth year of championing the transformative power of open technologies.

title: Open technologies, public procurement and economic impact: lessons from Denmark for Europe’s next digital laws
content: Europe’s debate on cloud, artificial intelligence and digital sovereignty often assumes a trade-off between competitiveness, control, and cost. Evidence from public-sector procurement suggests the opposite. title: OFE’s Public Letter Calls on the EU to Invest in Sovereign Tech Fund
content:
Today, a new coalition of industry leaders, open source companies, and civil society has come together with OpenForum Europe to urge the EU to invest a minimum of €350 million to maintain critical open source software underpinning Europe’s digital infrastructure.
